page.title: 15TEENAGERS-ENTERTAINMENTS
page.content: From April to September they play outdoor bowls as members of the Junior Bowling Club.Also in the Community Centre,which used to be Crosshill Primary School,are facilities for playing table tennis, pool,board games and records.Discos are held on special occasions but these are not always well attended.Watching television or video tapes of horror films,at home, seems a more attractive proposition. Teenagers can also be seen sitting in groups at the War Memorial.Others ride round the village on motor bikes. In Kirkmichael parents run a youth club on a Friday night which involves table tennis,snooker,badminton,darts, record playing,card playing,reading and watching films.In the evenings in Spring and Summer teenagers hang about the pubs in groups.
